About the Role

The Executive Director, HR Business Partner at The Company is a strategic leadership role responsible for driving critical human capital initiatives and ensuring their alignment with business objectives. This includes leading activities related to employee engagement, workforce management, and performance management, as well as influencing key operational and strategic decisions. The role involves partnering with the VP Business Partner on HR operational priorities, contributing to the development of people strategies, and serving as an advocate for business leaders. The Executive Director also coaches leaders on change management strategies, advises on employment/employee relations matters, and ensures HR policies and outcomes are compliant with Joint Commission standards.

Candidates for this position must have a Bachelor's degree in HR Business (Master's preferred) and more than 10 years of related work experience, including at least 5 years of HR generalist experience and 1-3 years of supervisory/management experience. The ideal candidate will have a strong commitment to diversity, inclusion, and anti-racism, as well as knowledge of HR functions, policies, and relevant laws and regulations. Preferred qualifications include SPHR or SHRM-SP certification, experience with Workday HRM, and change management certification. The role requires strong competencies in decision-making, problem-solving, independence of action, written and oral communication, knowledge application, teamwork, and customer service.
